test_description: Verify Service Request is automatically routed to the correct Service Center based on User Location falling within a defined Service Area Polygon.
business_risk: Critical - Incorrect routing causes service delays and contractual violations.
technical_complexity: High - Involves PostGIS ST_Contains queries and brand authorization checks.
preconditions: Service Center A exists with defined Polygon P1 and Brand B authorization. User address geocodes to Point L inside P1.
test_steps: 1. User submits Service Request for Product (Brand B) with location L. 2. System triggers routing logic. 3. System queries PostGIS for polygons containing L linked to Brand B.
expected_result: Service Request is assigned to Service Center A. Notification dispatched to SC Admin.
test_data_needs: GeoJSON Polygons, Valid Geocoded User Address, Brand-SC association records.
dependencies: PostGIS extension, Service Center Management Module
success_criteria: Routing occurs < 200ms; Assignment is persisted atomically.
cleanup_requirements: Truncate Service Requests; Reset Service Center Allocations
security_considerations: Ensure tenant isolation logic applies during routing lookup.

test_description: Verify end-to-end latency of technician location updates from Mobile App to User Map is under 2 seconds.
business_risk: High - Poor tracking experience degrades user trust and increases support calls.
technical_complexity: Very High - Involves WebSocket Gateway, Redis Buffer, and Mobile Background Services.
preconditions: Technician App active in 'Travel Mode'. Consumer App connected to WebSocket. Valid JWTs for both.
test_steps: 1. Mock Technician App emits GPS coordinate payload (t0). 2. Backend Gateway receives, buffers in Redis, and broadcasts to room. 3. Consumer App receives payload (t1). 4. Measure delta (t1 - t0).
expected_result: Delta (t1 - t0) < 2000ms. Coordinate data is accurate.
tools_required: k6 (WebSocket testing), Socket.io-client, Custom Latency Probe
dependencies: Redis, WebSocket Gateway, Push Notification Service
environment_requirements: Performance Env with network throttling capability
success_criteria: P95 Latency < 2s under load of 1000 concurrent streams.
security_considerations: Validate WSS Token Authentication; Ensure user can only subscribe to their own ticket's channel.

test_description: Verify Circuit Breaker behavior when Azure AI Document Intelligence is unresponsive.
business_risk: Medium - Feature unavailability prevents automated registration, requires fallback.
preconditions: Azure AI Service mocked to return 503 or timeout.
test_steps: 1. Upload Invoice Image via API. 2. Backend worker attempts OCR processing. 3. Service fails 5 times sequentially.
expected_result: Circuit Breaker opens. System returns 'OCR Unavailable' status to client. Manual entry form requested. Message queued to DLQ if async.
dependencies: Azure AI Document Intelligence, Polly (Resilience Library)
success_criteria: System does not crash; Fallback UI state triggered.
accessibility_requirements: Manual entry form fallback must be WCAG 2.1 AA compliant.
